title: Segfaults and hangs during check-stage1-std
body:
On Windows 8.1 x64 with MSYS2 using mingw64.
Running `make check-stage1-std` hangs part way through the tests about half the time.
Which point it hangs on is non-deterministic, although it does prefer to hang at certain points more often.
Hang points for 30 hanging runs:

```
test sync::future::test::test_interface_unwrap ... ok
test collections::hash::map::test_map::test_keys ... ok
test os::tests::test_self_exe_path ... ok
test io::net::tcp::test::smoke_test_ip6 ... ok
test io::fs::test::binary_file ... ok
test collections::hash::map::test_map::test_keys ... ok
test io::extensions::test::push_at_least_eof ... ok
test path::windows::tests::test_display_str ... ok
test io::fs::test::file_test_io_non_positional_read ... ok
test io::net::tcp::test::smoke_test_ip6 ... ok
test collections::hash::map::test_map::test_keys ... ok
test rand::test::test_gen_f64 ... ok
test io::fs::test::file_test_io_seek_shakedown ... ok
test os::tests::test_self_exe_path ... ok
test io::net::pipe::tests::timeout_concurrent_read ... ok
test io::mem::test::test_vec_writer ... ok
test f64::tests::test_integer_decode ... ok
test io::net::tcp::test::smoke_test_ip6 ... ok
test io::net::pipe::tests::timeout_concurrent_read ... ok
test io::timer::test::periodic_zero ... ok
test io::net::tcp::test::smoke_test_ip6 ... ok
test collections::hash::map::test_map::test_is_empty ... ok
test io::timer::test::periodic_zero ... ok
test os::tests::test_self_exe_path ... ok
test comm::test::stress_shared::f ... ok
test io::net::tcp::test::smoke_test_ip6 ... ok
test num::tests::test_i16_cast ... ok
test sync::task_pool::test::test_zero_tasks_panic ... ok
test io::timer::test::periodic_zero ... ok
test io::mem::test::test_vec_writer ... ok
```

When using GDB, it sometimes runs successfully, and sometimes hits a segfault. The point at which the segfault is hit correlates to the same points at which hangs frequently occur.

```
Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
[Switching to Thread 12652.0x125c]
0x00007ffee4d58299 in ?? ()
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007ffee4d58299 in ?? ()
#1  0x00000000687b5579 in je_malloc_mutex_lock ()
    at A:/msys64/home/retep998/rust/src/jemalloc/include/jemalloc/internal/mutex.h:73
#2  je_arena_malloc_small ()
    at A:/msys64/home/retep998/rust/src/jemalloc/src/arena.c:1478
#3  0x000000006879b52a in je_arena_malloc ()
    at A:/msys64/home/retep998/rust/src/jemalloc/include/jemalloc/internal/arena.h:1081
#4  je_imalloct () at include/jemalloc/internal/jemalloc_internal.h:643
#5  je_imalloc () at include/jemalloc/internal/jemalloc_internal.h:652
#6  imallocx_no_prof ()
    at A:/msys64/home/retep998/rust/src/jemalloc/src/jemalloc.c:1526
#7  je_mallocx ()
    at A:/msys64/home/retep998/rust/src/jemalloc/src/jemalloc.c:1551
#8  0x00000000007b5194 in sys::thread_local::on_tls_callback::h75906da4fa09a7f1xmr ()
#9  0x0000000002800000 in ?? ()
#10 0x000000000281c100 in ?? ()
#11 0x0000000000000003 in ?? ()
#12 0x00007ffee358123a in ?? () from C:\WINDOWS\system32\ws2_32.dll
#13 0x000000000281c100 in ?? ()
#14 0x0000000000000000 in ?? ()
(gdb)
```
